Module simplifier
Package ie.gmit.dip

Class OneToOneMappedThesaurus

  • java.lang.Object
    • ie.gmit.dip.OneToOneMappedThesaurus
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Thesaurable<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String,​java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String>>
    public class OneToOneMappedThesaurus
extends java.lang.Object
implements Thesaurable<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String,​java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String>>
    OneToOneMappedThesaurus is a concrete class which implements the Thesaurable interface. In broad terms, it simply maps one String to another String via a HashMap, and therefore provides a simple one-to-one mapping of words to their synonym. This class is responsible for state and behavior related to adding, searching, and removing the words and synonyms in a thesaurus. Since virtually all operations are delegated to a HashMap, the running time complexity of a HashMap are expected in all cases with O(c) running time typical for most methods.
    Since:
    JavaSE-11
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Kieran P. Somers
